author: cardano4climate
title: Onboarding through events
description: It is difficult and overwhelming for newcomers to navigate the different areas of Catalyst and wind up overwhelmed and unsure where to start

f6_assessments.q0: As a relative newcomer myself sometimes I do feel overwhelmed with the abundance of information on the Cardano ecosystem and crypto as a whole. The team tries to overcome the challenge by bringing thematic events that can attract newcomers thus they have a starting point they are already interested in. I also appreciate that the team provides past events documentation, potential risks, and how to address those risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal gave details information on current members count, past events, and activities. The team also provides a detailed and reasonable breakdown of how they will use the proposed budget. However, even though the team has demonstrated the ability to execute in past events it will be helpful to provide evidence of relevant skills and experience for each 8 core members such as LinkedIn profile.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics for success are the number of engagement for various social media and participants in the event itself. Goals for the Telegram channel and Discord server members and event participants are clearly defined. However, the goals for Twitter and youtube don’t have an exact number and its better to be filled with measurable achievements like other social media and the number of participants on the event.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is well aligned with the challenge. It makes sense that overwhelm due to difficulty in navigating Project Catalyst will impede the efforts of newcomers, thus making it harder to realize growth across the KPIs of the General onboarding and Innovation process metrics of the challenge.  The proposal’s solution, which is to run monthly impact-related thematic events to attract and onboard newcomers, could make a difference by attracting more people to project Catalyst, thereby raising awareness.  More people will lead to more weekly sign-ups to Cardano Ideascale and increasing attendance to Townhall, Catalyst School, and Swarm sessions.  This could eventually increase the numbers to the KPIs of the Innovation process metric.  The proposal’s sponsor, Climate4Cardano, is a known entity in the Cardano ecosystem and has experience hosting events and onboarding newcomers.  Their focus on climate draws a passionate audience committed to their cause of a sustainable future.  The risks to the proposal have been well thought out and have accompanying mitigation strategies.
f6_assessments.q1:
The six-member core team is described in terms of their roles but provides little in the way of their background and experience.  The description of the team could be improved by providing more details about their experience and accomplishments.  The core team is backed up by their 200 plus members worldwide, presumably who have made themselves available to help if necessary.

Cardano4Climate is an active participant in Project Catalyst and the Cardano ecosystem. They have over 234 members in their Telegram Group, 55 subscribers on their Youtube channel, and 377 users on their discord server. They demonstrate their ability to grow their community and collaborate with other communities. They use social media and meetups as tools to welcome newcomers and help them start their Cardano journey.

The budget is clear as to what the funds will be allocated to.
f6_assessments.q2: Transparency will be facilitated through a repository on GitHub.  KPIs have been set for this project with clear metrics by which progress and success can be measured, which include a 15% increase per month in the growth rate of their Telegram channel and Discord server and an ambitious 50% increase per month in the number of participants in Cardano4Climate events.
f6_assessments.reply: All the reviews for impact, feasibility and auditability are positive so not clear why 4 stras and not 5.

f6_assessments.q0: I think that this is a huge step in the right direction for the Cardano community. I have seen how it can be difficult for newcomers to navigate the Cardano ecosystem and getting involved with IOHK and Project Catalyst. The proposal addressed the challenge that they face and gave a great way for this to be mitigated. I like that they listed off the different Risks and how they plan to mitigate them. They seem to be very concerned about the well-being of the Cardano Community and have a focus on the education of the newcomers to Cardano. Their goal to create events in the community will be huge. These events that will be intriguing to new people because they are focused on things that normal people are fond. This includes environmental friendly activity such as plastic waste, carbon usage, and planting trees.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal gives information on all of the participants of this company. They already have a name in the Cardano Community. This includes them having a twitter and discord and seems to be a project that is already growing. By receiving the funds, they will be able to get the word out more and give opportunities for newcomers to join the ecosystem by implementing environmentally friendly events. It seems to be very likely that this proposal will help the ecosystem. The funds requested seem to fit the adequate amount for a proposal/plan such as this.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal offers many great things such as their active community that continues to increase. I think that their ideas are backed with clear evidence that shows how they are going to utilize the funds given to them in the proposal and how this will engage the community further. There is a clear explanation on how the funds will be used and their expectations of onboarding new members into the community that will have great ideas to further the growth of Cardano and projects building on Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: The New Member Onboarding challenge has a maim aim of increasing the number of qualified challenge teams, proposers, advisers, mentors, and voters available. The goal of this proposal is to provide monthly impact-related thematic events in order to attract and onboard newcomers and strengthen community participation. According to this plan, it would continue to offer monthly events to build value, engage the community, and provide an atmosphere and location where work on the difficult challenges of Climate Change can be done while leveraging Cardano blockchain technology to speed effects. By having thematic events new members are attracted who are passionate about the subjects as well as having engagement from members already on board and this can help onboard qualified members to the Catalyst ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer demonstrates that he possesses both the expertise and the competence to carry out the idea. The proposer has clearly identified the team members who will be needed to carry out the plan, as well as a budget that is appropriate in order to meet the objectives. Furthermore, the proposal includes a realistic completion timetable as well as a clear and precise implementation strategy that outlines what will be done and how it will be done. The proposer has explored potential implementation challenges and offered suggested solutions. As a result, the above-mentioned problem solution has a strong possibility of being implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: •	The proposal offers enough information to audit and evaluate the project's progress toward its stated goals, since it elaborates the implementation techniques and success measurement criteria, thanks to the well-developed material from the effect and feasibility categories.

f6_assessments.q0: Overall, this project is well-put together, and would have a high chance of succeeding if it were put into another Challenge category, specifically the Miscellaneous Challenge, or if there were a climate related challenge. However, as written and submitted to the New Member Onboarding Challenge, there is not enough to recommend it to be approved. For example, while the opening statement addresses bringing in new members, the proposal's targets appear more aimed at growing Cardano's influence over climate issues. This is a notable and worthy goal, but does not on the surface coincide with the Challenge's focus. There appears to be little measurable mention of how the project's climate events will lead to an increase in Ideascale signups, Townhall attendance, Catalyst School attendance, etc. Overall I would fully endorse this proposal in another category, but as it stand here, it does not seem to effectively address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: This plan appears highly likely to succeed. This group comes across well-organized, and this proposal is well-written and serious lays out a solid plan for developing unique and engaging events to grow Cardano's influence in the area of climate issues. They have presented an appropriate awareness of the risks they face, and have presented effective solutions to these risks. This group has shown a track record of creating and putting on the events that they plan. The team members seem competent and qualified to execute the plan they laid out. Their budget and timeline for putting on these events seems to be fair and adequate to accomplish the tasks. The events that they have put on in the past are presented and while there is room for future growth and development, they do a good job engaging with people on the topic of climate. The budget they request is well thought-through and appropriate for such events. Overall, I would love to see this project get funded, as it would help to develop the Cardano Network to grow and have more influence over climate issues.
f6_assessments.q2: It seems highly likely that not only will this proposal be carried out, but that it would be done with a high degree of transparency. The team has already developed a public accountability process by provided details on GitHub, and creating a larger team to help with their stated goals. They have sufficient public social media with regular updates and consistent involvement from others outside the team. They have set clear accountability goals such as growth of twitter, discord, etc. They have also clearly stated their timeline for presenting these event. This proposal in addition to their previous events, and history of open meetings, and involving outsiders has earned them a fair amount of credibility in my eyes.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Problem statement of the project "It is difficult and overwhelming for newcomers to navigate the different areas of Catalyst and wind up overwhelmed and unsure where to start" is defined as personal opinion. I do not find evidence, observations or facts, as well as reference sources of information or data if this is a real problem for the community and how it affect it.

It is stated "The guiding questions for the challenge are all covered by the events so there is a high alignment with the challenge". I would suggest a clear explanation to be added of how exactly are they aligned.

Proposed solution - running thematic events (Climate-related conferences) do not correspond with the Key Metrics of the Challenge, as well as with the identified problem for the orientation of new members in the various areas of Catalyst.
Attracting new members “who are passionate about the subjects [of the conferences/events]” do not necessary means they will “take on suitable roles and responsibilities” in Catalyst, which is the goal of this Challenge.

Only two of the identified risks are directly related to the activities of the current project and the characteristics of the Challenge (The growth of the community can outstrip our ability to successfully facilitate events effectively; If not done well, there can be ineffective onboarding and missed opportunities to connect newcomers with the right community channels).
f6_assessments.q1:
Instead of a detailed plan and timeline for delivering the solution, the team describes previous events organized on the topics of sustainability, as well as their involvement in various activities in the community. Providing plan and timeline will make more visible the way outcomes of the project could be achieved.

The team plans to hold three Catalyst Sustainability Goals Events inside the project, which is a natural continuation of the previous activities of the C4C community and core team. I miss a detailed plan for implementation of activities.

The budget is broken down into items, but they are not described in detail and justified by specific activities / materials / time worked, etc.
The expertise of the individual team members is not clearly proven in the proposal. Their capacity to carry out the proposed activities can be understood only from the provided examples of successfully organized previous events.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team declare it will hold 3 (one per month) Catalyst Sustainability Goals events. These are easy to trace and clearly visible activities. However, these activities are not directly related to the announced Challenge Key Metrics.

Only two of the identified KPIs are accompanied by measurable indicators (Monthly growth rate of our Telegram channel & Discord Server by 15% per month; Increase average number of participants in Cardano4Climate events by 50% per month), the rest are only marked as opportunities without measurable indicators (Number of Followers on Twitter; Number of Video-Clicks, Likes & Followers on YouTube).

All KPIs are aimed at increasing the popularity of the C4C community and not the main goal of this Challenge - to make it faster and easier for new Catalyst members to take on suitable roles and responsibilities in 2022.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is related to the challenge by focusing on onboarding of new members and creating more meaningful participation and engagement. The solution is focused on holding impact-driven events for sustainability related topics, e.g., Climate Change. By setting a focus, the team is already “setting a filter” for those newcomers to identify “sustainability” related to Cardano/Catalyst quite efficient. With the concept the team is opening up a channel to relate to the “external” world (non Cardano/Catalyst related) which is a good door opener for both (create awareness of Catalyst and to externals: get to know “another like-minded community” in the Blockchain space).
f6_assessments.q1: The team already delivers on three event formats successfully, which is a strong point and gives credibility to the team and format they have been chosen. It brings people together – both form external and internal of the Cardano/Catalyst community. Your proposal could have even more strength if you could refer to outcomes delivered by those events, in terms of your footprint in the community but furthermore connecting people/projects or new initiatives where more can benefit.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a project already been executed and the team is requesting to fund further 3-month period for holding 3 events. Roadmap and team is in place. KPIs as well are placed and cover the operation as it is. The solution is pointing out to focus on building stronger engagement – I would have loved to see how the team is break down this dimension of the project to tangible and measurable metrics. I see high potential in doing so on an more “group” dimension like you pointed out having joint efforts with SustainableADA, or thinking about outside ventures. Those partnerships could send the ground for a more impactful engagement from a “partnership” perspective (in a first phase). Overall a needed proposal, strong team and case for building something important and IMPACTFUL ;o)

f6_assessments.q0:
Although the headline of this proposal is onboarding, it unfortunately ends there. For onboarding to be effective, there needs to be engagement plans to retain interest of these onboarded members. Which this proposal lacks. There are some brief mentions of their action plans in the "risk and mitigation" paragraph but there is no actual plan stated in detail to build towards their goals. Example; they mention "Sharing Info and Education". What info and what education do they seek to achieve? This is a key point, for the key metrics of this Challenge, clearly states what is needed to be achieved (e.g. growth in proposals, growth in CA's, growth in voters etc.).

Although this is a great topic and is a crucial one, it would be in their best interest if somehow the new onboarded members were to be funneled into submitting a proposal. Or perhaps to be involved in the Project Catalyst process, for the goal to onboard is not for the sake just to onboard, but for them to be engaged, involved and build on Cardano. From a technological standpoint, I do wonder how can this topic benefit Cardano. Inherently Cardano indeed is a "greener" technology than that of proof-of-work, but other than Veritree, the potential of regenerative farming, carbon neutral NFT's and perhaps a hint of traceability, I have not seen further use cases of Cardano. This niche-ness of this particular community is perhaps their strength and weakness.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team assembled no doubt are veterans of the Cardano community, prior to funding they have as stated, already started their efforts on this onboarding event. And have continuously done so. In that limited aspect they have and will continue to deliver what seek to do, seeing that the complexity of this proposal is straightforward.

Their action plan and budget is fitting to what they want to achieve, which again is onboarding and creating discussions. Though more detail would be desirable. There is a mentioning of documentation and video production but it is unclear the goal of this. Will this mean they will be producing bespoke materials on education how Cardano can effect climate change? Or is this just recording the Zoom sessions of the 3 (three) events they seek to have? There's also the mentioning of marketing but not specific to whom. But again due to the straightforwardness of this proposal perhaps those are KPI's that can be overlooked.
f6_assessments.q2: They are using numerous tools to measure their progress which is excellent and should be the norm of every Cardano based community. From the use of GitHub, Telegram, Discord, Twitter etc. all are great metrics tool to gauge growth and to push the community handlers to finds ways to keep growing. They are providing full transparency which also echoes to their target metrics. The majority of their metrics are numerical, therefore at the end of this proposal one can gauge their success very easily.

solution: We will run monthly impact-related thematic events to attract and onboard newcomers and build stronger community engagement.
experience: Cardano4climate is a community-driven project which emerged itself through engagement in Project Catalyst. We have run 3 successful events to date (a 4th planned soon). We proactively participate in building the Cardano Ecosystem and provide constant services to our Community.
